image.altText: A young woman with long blonde wavy hair, red t-shirt, blurred greenery in the background, sun hitting back of her head

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest rate of sexual violence in Australia, with experts warning there's been a steep increase in children presenting with harmful sexualised behaviours.

title.children: The NT has the nation's highest rate of sexual violence, and it's worsening

image.altText: A woman in a t-shirt stands in front of a quick-flowing river in the remote Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Scientists say one of the Northern Territory's most important water systems is experiencing "significant depletion".

title.children: NT's vast Cambrian Limestone Aquifer 'getting drier', research finds

image.altText: Two SES workers wearing orange uniforms, searching through a grassy landscape.

props.synopsis: The search for missing Alice Springs man Gach Top has been suspended after five days, after police and the SES sought local advice from trail guides and family friends.

title.children: Police suspend search for missing 26yo man Gach Top in Red Centre

image.altText: An old dark skinned man wearing a red headband frowns

props.synopsis: Warlpiri elder Ned Jampijinpa Hargraves joins growing calls for federal intervention into law and justice policies in the Northern Territory.

title.children: 'They are using their power to destroy us': Elder’s urgent appeal to PM

image.altText: An aerial view of a wharf part of the Darwin Port, with the city of Darwin in the distance.

props.synopsis: A falling object has crushed a worker's pelvis during an accident involving a crane at Darwin's industrial port area.

title.children: Falling object crushes worker's pelvis in industrial accident

image.altText: A woman with cropped dark curly hair stands leaning against a bright pink mural.

props.synopsis: When it comes to suicide prevention, Samantha McIntosh knows more than most, and senior lecturer Dr Anton Isaacs believes her lived experience is essential to turning the tide in Australia's mental health space.

title.children: Meet the woman pushing to turn suicide prevention on its head

image.altText: A cricketer wearing official whites.

props.synopsis: It's been 15 years since Jake Weatherald moved south to pursue his dream of becoming a professional cricketer, but it was the return to Darwin that served as one of his life's defining moments.

title.children: Darwin-born professional cricketer shines in home-game debut

image.altText: A close-up shot of a politician speaking to media.

props.synopsis: After politicising the stabbing of a 15-year-old boy at the Darwin Show, the Northern Territory government has battened down the hatches with its rhetoric. The subtext: You're either with us, or against us.

title.children: 'Gutter trash': A government hell-bent on change tears down its critics

image.altText: An old image of a young police man in khaki uniform, smiling with a police hat on

props.synopsis: An expert in trauma and suicide has told a coronial inquest into the death of a veteran officer that better mental health checks within the police force would likely have flagged him as an "officer at risk".

title.children: PTSD expert urges NT police to prioritise mental health screening

image.altText: Dr Mo in the Kimberley

props.synopsis: Mohammed 'Dr Mo' Mustafa might only be a junior doctor from Perth, but he's got the ear of leaders from around the world as he tries to turn his dream of a children's hospital in Gaza into reality.

title.children: After seeing the horrors in Gaza, Dr Mo embarked on a near-impossible mission

image.altText: Two women crying and mourning in an outside garden

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Red Crescent Society says one staffer is dead after an Israeli strike on its headquarters in the Gaza city of Khan Younis.

title.children: More starvation deaths reported in Gaza as Israel hits Red Crescent HQ

image.altText: Lynne McGranger on the red carpet wearing a gold dress at the logies, smiling

props.synopsis: Home and Away's Lynne McGranger wins the Gold Logie at the 65th awards ceremony. Meanwhile, the ABC also wins big, with Fisk taking out numerous awards.

title.children: Lynne McGranger wins Gold Logie, ABC dominates in numerous categories

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: A combination of worse-than-expected jobs data and the new tariff regime have hit US stocks hard. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street tumbles on weak jobs report and ASX slips

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX marginally lower on opening, gold miners in demand

image.altText: power pole down across white house surrounded by green fields.

props.synopsis: Emergency flood warnings remain in place in parts of NSW, as the search for a 26-year-old woman missing in the Hunter region resumes this morning.

title.children: Four emergency warnings, 20,000 without power after wild weather in NSW

image.altText: Snow covered volcanic mountain peak.

props.synopsis: Glaciers on the remote Australian territory of Heard Island have lost almost a quarter of their size over the past seven decades amid rising temperatures in the sub-Antarctic region, new research shows.

title.children: Melting glaciers on remote Australian island spark concern

image.altText: Jim Chalmers, wearing a thoughtful expression, stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: Voters younger than their mid-40s are consistently telling pollsters they believe the system is stacked against them. They have made it crystal clear they are hungry for change.

title.children: Negative gearing reform is back, but young voters now hold the power

image.altText: Robert Irwin leans against a 4WD on the beach

props.synopsis: Tourism Australia will splash out on a $130 million international campaign to lure visitors to the country, with Robert Irwin front and centre.

title.children: Robert Irwin the face of new Tourism Australia marketing campaign

image.altText: Navy recruits celebrating their graduation

props.synopsis: Targeted advertising on social media and in online games has helped deliver a boost to Australian Defence Force recruitment, offsetting a perennial problem of declining service rates.

title.children: TikTok and online games deliver military recruitment surge

image.altText: a volcano eurpts sending white ash cloud high into the sky

props.synopsis: Staff at the Kronotsky Nature Reserve, where the volcano is located, say the eruption sent ash 6 kilometres into the sky.

title.children: Russian volcano erupts for first time in centuries

image.altText: A man wearing a red jumpsuit and a woman wearing a black tshirt perform on stage

props.synopsis: East Arnhem Land may be a vast wilderness but it doesn't stop giving when it comes to cultivating Australia's greatest First Nations figures.

title.children: The distant part of Australia breeding some of our most loved performers

image.altText: Graphic of a woman looking out onto a hospital. She looks disheveled with messy hair, back turned against the shot.

props.synopsis: Two psychiatrists have told the ABC authorities failed to help protect them from a patient who allegedly violently attacked them and other health professionals.

title.children: 'Red flags ignored' about mentally unwell woman now in custody

image.altText: Mimi Rhodes holds her ball up after a hole-in-one

props.synopsis: Australian Steph Kyriacou is involved in another hole-in-one, this time for a rival player, as Japan's Miyu Yamashita takes out the Women's British Open.

title.children: Tee shot bounces off Aussie's ball for hole-in-one at British Open

image.altText: Black and white still from CCTV footage of a man wearing a Scream mask and black clothing riding an e-scooter

props.synopsis: CCTV footage shows a masked male spray painting offensive phrases on a Melbourne synagogue.

title.children: Police release CCTV footage of male defacing Melbourne synagogue

image.altText: A young woman sits on a bed holding an insulin pump.

props.synopsis: Patients like Sammy Haigh spend hundreds of dollars every month managing their diabetes, as calls for increased subsidies grow.

title.children: 'Game-changing' diabetes technologies out of reach as cost of living climbs

image.altText: Meg Harris with her arms aloft on the medal podium

props.synopsis: Meg Harris rounds out her swimming championships in style with a gold medal in the 50m freestyle final, but it isn't enough to help Australia overtake the United States in the final medal tally.

title.children: Harris's freestyle gold not enough to help Australia top swimming medal tally

image.altText: A low shot across the water of a swimming pool, with swimmers coming towards the camera and the sun setting in the background.

props.synopsis: Swimming Queensland says the state government is failing to invest in the next generation of athletes, while planning to spend billions on Olympic infrastructure.

title.children: Funding shortfall threatens position as top swimming nation, coaches say

image.altText: GettyImages-2187549030

props.synopsis: North Melbourne star Jasmine Garner will have the added responsibility of guiding her side through the club's premiership defence in her first season as captain.

title.children: The unique hangover cure bonding AFLW premiers for life

image.altText: Minecraft graphic of an adult and child seated beside each other

props.synopsis: Rather than battling over device time with children, one clinical psychologist is recommending "meeting children where they are" as a first step to fostering family conversations, and even letting kids self-regulate their use.

title.children: Parent of autistic child ditches screen time rules and finds success

image.altText: Joe Root holds his bat and helmet aloft in celebration

props.synopsis: Joe Root's 39th Test century leaves England on the brink of a famous Test victory but his dismissal has India harbouring thoughts of tying a thrilling series on its final day.

title.children: England and India set for gripping finale as Root leaves door ajar

image.altText: A middle-aged white woman sitting in a wheelchair

props.synopsis: Australia's disability discrimination commissioner wants Queensland to scrap plans to build more special schools amid state plans to build more.

title.children: Commissioner says Queensland 'ignoring' advice on inclusive education

image.altText: A man wearing a maroon shirt on a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Sam Backo has died after a three-month battle with tropical soil disease melioidosis and complications related to an ongoing heart condition.

title.children: Rugby league great Sam Backo dies after battle with melioidosis

image.altText: A smiling man holding up large wedges of cheese, bottles, cheese behind, wears yellow cap backwards, rust jumper, dark neckline.

props.synopsis: High heater use, population growth and a push towards electrification has seen an uptick in unplanned power outages in Canberra this winter as the electricity network struggles to cope with record demand.

title.children: Canberra's record power outages leave business owners like Alex nervous

image.altText: A young man smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Riley Turnbull was a healthy teenager, but when his kidneys started failing, his world changed.

title.children: Healthy, sport-obsessed teen's world changed by kidney failure

image.altText: Photos by still journalist Rachel Pupazzoni of Rio Tinto operations in Western Australia.

props.synopsis: A move to amend the Local Government Act after the Supreme Court ruled a Midwest shire could rate a miner is described as an "extraordinary step" to "undermine" the decision by the WA Local Government Association.

title.children: WA government to amend act after court rules council can rate miner
